definition: to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast

sentences.english: Once it was heated, up to four slices of bread could be toasted at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 只要把它加熱就可以烘烤4片面包。

sentences.english: Bake approx 30 minutes until golden brown.
sentences.chinese: 烘烤30分鐘左右，直到鬆餅呈金棕色。

sentences.english: The wood was fired into charcoal for baking tea leaves.
sentences.chinese: 木頭燒成炭後用來烘烤茶葉。

sentences.english: Set me whereas the sun doth parch the green.
sentences.chinese: 無論將我放在烈日烘烤綠地之處。

sentences.english: We caught piranhas and smoked them over a fire.
sentences.chinese: 我們抓住食人魚，將它們架在火上烘烤。

sentences.english: About 1-2 min before time is up, toast English muffins next to burgers.
sentences.chinese: 烹調時間尚餘1分鐘時，放入英式鬆餅同時烘烤。

sentences.english: Cook the pie for 20 minutes in a pre-heated oven.
sentences.chinese: 在經過預熱的烤箱裏烘烤餡餅20分鐘。

sentences.english: Leavened bread is bread that rises. It is usually baked in an oven.
sentences.chinese: 發酵麪包是膨鬆的麪包，它通常在烤箱裏烘烤而成。

sentences.english: We roasted the pig on a spit.
sentences.chinese: 我們在一根鐵叉上烘烤了豬。

sentences.english: These cakes were baked in batches of twenty.
sentences.chinese: 這些蛋糕是以二十個爲一爐烘烤的。

sentences.english: Chinese normally steam or fry their foods, not bake them.
sentences.chinese: 中國人通常把食物拿來蒸或炒，而不用烘烤的。

sentences.english: But the original Cuban sandwich wasn’t toasted.
sentences.chinese: 但是最初的古巴三明治並不烘烤。

sentences.english: I bought a bit of baking powder and baked a batch of biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 我買了位發酵粉並且烘烤了批餅乾。

sentences.english: Line a baking sheet with baking paper.
sentences.chinese: 排上帶烘烤紙的烘乾板。

sentences.english: Borscht can be spiced up with roasted apples and smoked goose breast.
sentences.chinese: 羅宋湯可以用烘烤過的蘋果和薰鵝脯來提味。

sentences.english: The kitchen is filled with the warm, fragrant odor of her baking.
sentences.chinese: 廚房裏瀰漫着熱呼呼的烘烤香味。

definition: to scorch/(of the sun) to beat down on
to smoke/to cure over a wood fire
to bake/to heat by fire/to set off by contrast
